revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-04-02 17:56:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_portgroup.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/network/test_common.py', 'ironic/objects/portgroup.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/portgroup.py', 'ironic/cmd/dbsync.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_port.py', 'ironic/common/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_portgroup.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_port.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/network/common.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/utils.py', 'ironic/common/release_mappings.py', 'ironic/objects/port.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'ironic/db/api.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_models.py', 'releasenotes/notes/migrate_vif_port_id-5e1496638240933d.yaml'], 'message': "Copy port[group] VIF info from extra to internal_info

For API versions >= 1.28, Port & portgroup's .extra['vif_port_id'] was
deprecated in Ocata. Before we can remove support for this, we need to
copy that information to the object's internal_info['tenant_vif_port_id'].

This copy/migration is done at the API layer when the user specifies the
.extra[] value, as well as when the 'ironic db-sync online_data-migrations'
is run.

In order to know whether the ports and port groups have been migrated,
their IronicObject versions are incremented.

This also fixes it so that for API versions < 1.28, the deprecation
warning is not shown, since we still need to support extra['vif_port_id']
in this case.

When a port or portgroup's .extra['vif_port_id'] is removed via a
PATCH API request, that VIF is removed from that object's internal_info.

Change-Id: I69468c935e68dd9d37a474c318c3ceb9cdfc5868
Partial-Bug: 1722850
"}]
commit_message:
Copy port[group] VIF info from extra to internal_info

For API versions >= 1.28, Port & portgroup's .extra['vif_port_id'] was
deprecated in Ocata. Before we can remove support for this, we need to
copy that information to the object's internal_info['tenant_vif_port_id'].

This copy/migration is done at the API layer when the user specifies the
.extra[] value, as well as when the 'ironic db-sync online_data-migrations'
is run.

In order to know whether the ports and port groups have been migrated,
their IronicObject versions are incremented.

This also fixes it so that for API versions < 1.28, the deprecation
warning is not shown, since we still need to support extra['vif_port_id']
in this case.

When a port or portgroup's .extra['vif_port_id'] is removed via a
PATCH API request, that VIF is removed from that object's internal_info.

Partial-Bug: 1722850

This follows a change made to devstack-gate in commit 841ebc3 to allow
tempest to succeed even if it happens to run several volume tests in
parallel.  Right now it's possible for a tempest-full test (run without
devstack-gate) to fail with an "Insufficient free virtual space" error in
the cinder-scheduler log.

Suggested by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1743597
Change-Id: I16ccb9976d1bc7c9f56a6a4d73e35042a5867ef9
'}]
commit_message:
Bump the Cinder LVM backing file size to 24Gb.

This follows a change made to devstack-gate in commit 841ebc3 to allow
tempest to succeed even if it happens to run several volume tests in
parallel.  Right now it's possible for a tempest-full test (run without
devstack-gate) to fail with an "Insufficient free virtual space" error in
the cinder-scheduler log.

Suggested by: Clark Boylan <clark.boylan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1743597
Change-Id: I16ccb9976d1bc7c9f56a6a4d73e35042a5867ef9

commit_message:
Use six.text_type instead of str in NovaException __repr__

This change set is a follow up to change set
I653282a030d03362dfca0fd1026cebe920d54e37. In that change
set it was realized after merging that unicode values in
Exceptions would break when cast to a str. This change set
addresses that failure by using six.text_type instead of str.

Change-Id: I207ea18852d8b515e0c9034ec6df37094bf0b7d4
Closes-Bug: #1756360

recognized in string literals issue DeprecationWarnings.

Convert these to raw strings.

subject: Make image-create-via-import fail faster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-05 12:11:13.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell_v2.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "Make image-create-via-import fail faster

Add checks to the image-create-via-import commmand so that it provides
better user feedback and doesn't begin the import workflow unless the
input has a chance of succeeding.  Preserves backward compatibility
with the current image-create command by (1) allowing an image record
only to be created when no import-method is specified AND no data is
supplied, and (2) doing the glance-direct workflow when no import-
method is specified AND data is provided.  Also adds the ability for
the import-method to be set as an env var OS_IMAGE_IMPORT_METHOD.

Change-Id: I0a225f5471a9311217b5d90ebb5fd415c369129a
Closes-bug: #1758149
(cherry picked from commit 79543a67edd7a15aa23426548d3be9ac5b99366d)
"}]
commit_message:
Make image-create-via-import fail faster

Add checks to the image-create-via-import commmand so that it provides
better user feedback and doesn't begin the import workflow unless the
input has a chance of succeeding.  Preserves backward compatibility
with the current image-create command by (1) allowing an image record
only to be created when no import-method is specified AND no data is
supplied, and (2) doing the glance-direct workflow when no import-
method is specified AND data is provided.  Also adds the ability for
the import-method to be set as an env var OS_IMAGE_IMPORT_METHOD.

Change-Id: I0a225f5471a9311217b5d90ebb5fd415c369129a
Closes-bug: #1758149
(cherry picked from commit 79543a67edd7a15aa23426548d3be9ac5b99366d)

commit_message:
Change a parameter key for CIFS mounting command

While Huawei driver mounting CIFS filesystem, the username parameter
key passed to the mount command is by the form of "user=***", which's
compatible as "username=***" in Ubuntu. However, for some other
systems, such as Redhat, it is not valid.

This patch changes it to the more compatible form "username=***".

Change-Id: Ifa2ca7bcdceef2d47e2841a27ddf51d86f1ef63c
Closes-Bug: #1740816
(cherry picked from commit 5ef160ca7511ca92d8735cfca7bd176dee8ed995)
(cherry picked from commit 0b2ac684a8a91c3eee62872f512989a1abc77e3f)

Task: 6683

commit_message:
WIP: Use the Zuul VM as the seed

Rather than configuring the Zuul VM as a seed hypervisor, and using
nested virt to provision a seed VM, we use the zuul VM as the seed. This
should be more reliable, faster, and easier to get working, at the
expense of not testing the seed hypervisor code paths.

Change-Id: I038934930f431d824cd23d56f894f0afbd52a57b
Story: 2001655
Task: 6683

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 12:47:16.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml'], 'message': "Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582

(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)

commit_message:
Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582
Change-Id: Iebf279ca591e646656f8411934fd58dc43d5f002
(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)

commit_message:
rebuild a container with a different image

rebuild a container with a different image.
by this way, you can upgrade the container.
For example, rebuild a ubuntu:14.04 container to ubuntu:16.04 for upgrade.

Change-Id: Id08f7dca5de019da33695561f69976aaed6a022c
Implements:blueprint replace-image

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2018-04-05 14:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags-a23085f58bd22d27.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_config.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags

The recent "Meltdown" CVE fixes have resulted in a critical performance
penalty[*] that will impact every Nova guest with certain CPU models.

I.e. assume you have applied all the "Meltdown" CVE fixes, and performed
a cold reboot (explicit stop & start) of all Nova guests, for the
updates to take effect.  Now, if any guests that are booted with certain
named virtual CPU models (e.g. "IvyBridge", "Westmere", etc), then those
guests, will incur noticeable performance degradation[*], while being
protected from the CVE itself.

To alleviate this guest performance impact, it is now important to
specify an obscure Intel CPU feature flag, 'PCID' (Process-Context ID)
-- for the virtual CPU models that don't already include it (more on
this below).  To that end, this change will allow Nova to explicitly
specify CPU feature flags via a new configuration attribute,
`cpu_model_extra_flags`, e.g. in `nova.conf`:

    ...
    [libvirt]
    cpu_mode = custom
    cpu_model = IvyBridge
    cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid
    ...

NB: In the first iteration, the choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags` is
restricted to only 'pcid' (the option is case-insensitive) -- to address
the earlier mentioned guest performance degradation.  A future patch
will remove this restriction, allowing to add / remove multiple CPU
feature flags, thus making way for other useful features.

Some have asked: "Why not simply hardcode the 'PCID' CPU feature flag
into Nova?"  That's not graceful, and more importantly, impractical:

  (1) Not every Intel CPU model has 'PCID':

       - The only Intel CPU models that include the 'PCID' capability
         are: "Haswell", "Broadwell", and "Skylake" variants.

       - The libvirt / QEMU Intel CPU models: "Nehalem", "Westmere",
         "SandyBridge", and "IvyBridge" will *not* expose the 'PCID'
         capability, even if the host CPUs by the same name include it.
         I.e. 'PCID' needs to be explicitly when using the said virtual
         CPU models.

  (2) Magically adding new CPU feature flags under the user's feet
      impacts live migration.

[*] https://groups.google.com/forum/m/#!topic/mechanical-sympathy/L9mHTbeQLNU

Closes-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags

The recent "Meltdown" CVE fixes have resulted in a critical performance
penalty[*] that will impact every Nova guest with certain CPU models.

I.e. assume you have applied all the "Meltdown" CVE fixes, and performed
a cold reboot (explicit stop & start) of all Nova guests, for the
updates to take effect.  Now, if any guests that are booted with certain
named virtual CPU models (e.g. "IvyBridge", "Westmere", etc), then those
guests, will incur noticeable performance degradation[*], while being
protected from the CVE itself.

To alleviate this guest performance impact, it is now important to
specify an obscure Intel CPU feature flag, 'PCID' (Process-Context ID)
-- for the virtual CPU models that don't already include it (more on
this below).  To that end, this change will allow Nova to explicitly
specify CPU feature flags via a new configuration attribute,
`cpu_model_extra_flags`, e.g. in `nova.conf`:

    ...
    [libvirt]
    cpu_mode = custom
    cpu_model = IvyBridge
    cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid
    ...

NB: In the first iteration, the choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags` is
restricted to only 'pcid' (the option is case-insensitive) -- to address
the earlier mentioned guest performance degradation.  A future patch
will remove this restriction, allowing to add / remove multiple CPU
feature flags, thus making way for other useful features.

Some have asked: "Why not simply hardcode the 'PCID' CPU feature flag
into Nova?"  That's not graceful, and more importantly, impractical:

  (1) Not every Intel CPU model has 'PCID':

       - The only Intel CPU models that include the 'PCID' capability
         are: "Haswell", "Broadwell", and "Skylake" variants.

       - The libvirt / QEMU Intel CPU models: "Nehalem", "Westmere",
         "SandyBridge", and "IvyBridge" will *not* expose the 'PCID'
         capability, even if the host CPUs by the same name include it.
         I.e. 'PCID' needs to be explicitly when using the said virtual
         CPU models.

  (2) Magically adding new CPU feature flags under the user's feet
      impacts live migration.

[*] https://groups.google.com/forum/m/#!topic/mechanical-sympathy/L9mHTbeQLNU

Closes-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags

commit_message:
Fix join examples and text

The 'join' example for using a number did not have a proper workflow.
It looks like it was copied from the 'all' example and not completely
changed. Also, disambiguate the wording of the description for that
example. It used the word 'once' in a place where it looked as though
it meant 'one time' instead of 'as soon as'.

Change-Id: I9b89768c0f0b7d325db08ea9345965a9263a64c8
Closes-Bug: #1761827

commit_message:
Fix mode for openstack services

OpenStack services are generally http services. The mode for
these endpoints should be http otherwise logging will fallback
tcplog.

Change-Id: If3b50718027a4a52df3453feb6fc332d2966ffd0
Closes-Bug: #1759690

subject: Fix logic to require external bridge for computes in dvr mode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-15 09:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': "Fix logic to require external bridge for computes in dvr mode

With introduction of 'dvr_no_external' mode and new groups of
compute nodes (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510327) the
logic for requiring external bridges should take into account
what group a particular compute node is in. If it is
'inner-compute' then an external bridge is not required.

Change-Id: I9c9c0854ad93a92ca93e68ed26603061521ad621
Closes-Bug: #1755840
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic to require external bridge for computes in dvr mode

With introduction of 'dvr_no_external' mode and new groups of
compute nodes (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510327) the
logic for requiring external bridges should take into account
what group a particular compute node is in. If it is
'inner-compute' then an external bridge is not required.

Change-Id: I9c9c0854ad93a92ca93e68ed26603061521ad621
Closes-Bug: #1755840

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I14210959ffc1488a6422c6f254f92298bbcaab4b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2245, 'name': 'Jacky Hu', 'email': 'hudayou@hotmail.com', 'username': 'hudayou'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-08 12:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/keepalived.py'], 'message': 'Make keepalived initialization more predictable

This prevents forcing keepalived to renegotiate roles between amps more
times than necessary.

Keepalived is already running at the point that we do our initial "amp
start" command, so if we actually force a restart it loses its state and
has to renegotiate. I would consider the fact that this works without
issue right now "very good luck". Let's make this more sane, and only
reload if that's what we need to do.

Change-Id: Ie920bba9b2d718c59c6ce00c0f013058ed2634bb
'}]
commit_message:
Make keepalived initialization more predictable

This prevents forcing keepalived to renegotiate roles between amps more
times than necessary.

Keepalived is already running at the point that we do our initial "amp
start" command, so if we actually force a restart it loses its state and
has to renegotiate. I would consider the fact that this works without
issue right now "very good luck". Let's make this more sane, and only
reload if that's what we need to do.

Change-Id: Ie920bba9b2d718c59c6ce00c0f013058ed2634bb

commit_message:
Change sysmeta name from swift3 to s3api

And add a magic to translate existing swift3 sysmeta to s3api sysmeta
at swift.common.middleware.s3api.response.Response to upgrade easy from swift3
to s3api.

subject: Enable mutable config in Congress
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-09 03:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['congress/server/congress_server.py'], 'message': "Enable mutable config in Congress

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter. This commit is to use the same.

This allows Congress to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug logging
on and off by changing the config.

tc goal: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html
Change-Id: Ia82715af8a8174e4f0d89ee1d9609487654e4e03
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Congress

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter. This commit is to use the same.

This allows Congress to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug logging
on and off by changing the config.

tc goal: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html
Change-Id: Ia82715af8a8174e4f0d89ee1d9609487654e4e03

subject: Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-16 18:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC

This patch adds the OCTAVIA_USE_LEGACY_RBAC variable to our devstack plugin.
When set to True it will install the legacy Admin/Owner RBAC policy.json file
for the devstack Octavia install.
This is useful for tempest testing the neutron-lbaas proxy driver that passes
neutron LBaaSv2 API requests through to the Octavia API.

Change-Id: I5f112131b9c57e394349f29fa1b675643784b867
'}]
commit_message:
Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC

This patch adds the OCTAVIA_USE_LEGACY_RBAC variable to our devstack plugin.
When set to True it will install the legacy Admin/Owner RBAC policy.json file
for the devstack Octavia install.
This is useful for tempest testing the neutron-lbaas proxy driver that passes
neutron LBaaSv2 API requests through to the Octavia API.

Change-Id: I5f112131b9c57e394349f29fa1b675643784b867

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 16:42:34.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/nova-vnc-proxy.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml', 'puppet/services/nova-vnc-proxy.yaml', 'docker/services/nova-libvirt.yaml'], 'message': 'Correct the InternalTLSVncCAFile to comply with selinux policy

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however
/etc/ipa is etc_t.
Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is
arugably a more suitable location.

Change-Id: Ib275fc43dd772851511598a4932c19fcda706479
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the InternalTLSVncCAFile to comply with selinux policy

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however
/etc/ipa is etc_t.
Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is
arugably a more suitable location.

Change-Id: Ib275fc43dd772851511598a4932c19fcda706479

subject: Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 14:50:02.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/89-unbound'], 'message': "Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes

Currently /etc/resolv.conf is a dangling symlink on bionic:

root@ubuntu-bionic-inap-mtl01-0003371066:~# ls -l /etc/resolv.conf
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 39 Apr  6 01:29 /etc/resolv.conf ->
../run/systemd/resolve/stub-resolv.conf

Thus the

echo 'nameserver 127.0.0.1' > /etc/resolv.conf

in rc.local fails.

Change-Id: I423f5536836e85acabf364c325ebc5d1c44cb2ca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes

Currently /etc/resolv.conf is a dangling symlink on bionic:

root@ubuntu-bionic-inap-mtl01-0003371066:~# ls -l /etc/resolv.conf
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 39 Apr  6 01:29 /etc/resolv.conf ->
../run/systemd/resolve/stub-resolv.conf

Thus the

echo 'nameserver 127.0.0.1' > /etc/resolv.conf

in rc.local fails.

Change-Id: I423f5536836e85acabf364c325ebc5d1c44cb2ca

subject: Add redirect for python-openstacksdk project rename
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-23 14:54:14.000000000', 'files': ['www/.htaccess', 'www/redirect-tests.txt'], 'message': "Add redirect for python-openstacksdk project rename

Add a macro to make generating the redirect and tests for a project
rename easy.

Redirect python-openstacksdk to the new name openstacksdk.

Because the .htaccess template generates redirects for all official
projects, this patch won't pass the tests until the governance change
with the rename is approved and merged, so that patch is included as a
depends-on.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555780/
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I97afa686cac31b2ef8beac1df49f98625dee703d
"}]
commit_message:
Add redirect for python-openstacksdk project rename

Add a macro to make generating the redirect and tests for a project
rename easy.

Redirect python-openstacksdk to the new name openstacksdk.

Because the .htaccess template generates redirects for all official
projects, this patch won't pass the tests until the governance change
with the rename is approved and merged, so that patch is included as a
depends-on.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555780/
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I97afa686cac31b2ef8beac1df49f98625dee703d

commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
(cherry picked from commit e1231cd6eabb0992820d0c0fdc629c8a96b5f6b9)

commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
(cherry picked from commit e1231cd6eabb0992820d0c0fdc629c8a96b5f6b9)

commit_message:
Reverse sort previous elections output

Our current list appears to be unsorted at best, leading to an out of
order history of the previous elections.  Reverse the list displaying
recent (first) to latest (last) results.

Change-Id: I8228aeaac205c35633f3c6e5279497c6b7177125
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 01:32:51.000000000', 'files': ['zun/network/kuryr_network.py'], 'message': 'Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none

In the kuryr driver module, it tries to validate the subnetpool
even if the subnetpool_id is None. This incurrs an extra API
call to Neutron to list the subnetpools.

Change-Id: I0f25eadb68858ec89d00432b03f715c5cb6c0c46
'}]
commit_message:
Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none

In the kuryr driver module, it tries to validate the subnetpool
even if the subnetpool_id is None. This incurrs an extra API
call to Neutron to list the subnetpools.

Change-Id: I0f25eadb68858ec89d00432b03f715c5cb6c0c46

subject: Remove a redundant call of 'save'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 01:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['zun/network/kuryr_network.py'], 'message': "Remove a redundant call of 'save'

In the kuryr module, there is a call on saving the security groups
into the container object on processing the neutron port.
This call is unnecessary because the container object will be
saved again by caller. This patch removes this call.

Change-Id: I68ca6a7c70e1e1b576a3f2d560b480ff6d52e42e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove a redundant call of 'save'

In the kuryr module, there is a call on saving the security groups
into the container object on processing the neutron port.
This call is unnecessary because the container object will be
saved again by caller. This patch removes this call.

Change-Id: I68ca6a7c70e1e1b576a3f2d560b480ff6d52e42e

subject: Present container deletion better
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-09 03:11:56.000000000', 'files': ['zun_ui/static/dashboard/container/containers/actions/delete-force.service.js', 'zun_ui/static/dashboard/container/containers/actions/delete.service.js', 'zun_ui/static/dashboard/container/containers/actions/delete-stop.service.js'], 'message': "Present container deletion better

Zun server has changed from synchronous deletion to asynchronous
deletion. This mean Zun accepts a request to delete a container
but the container is not deleted right away. In the UI, it is
better to present the container in 'deleting' state instead of
removing the container from displaying.

Change-Id: I05c64a1388356887aba19dc94f27dbbd0d0bcc02
(cherry picked from commit 6f4827bea65134f152a85980bbe0a0accc0c26ce)
"}]
commit_message:
Present container deletion better

Zun server has changed from synchronous deletion to asynchronous
deletion. This mean Zun accepts a request to delete a container
but the container is not deleted right away. In the UI, it is
better to present the container in 'deleting' state instead of
removing the container from displaying.

Change-Id: I05c64a1388356887aba19dc94f27dbbd0d0bcc02
(cherry picked from commit 6f4827bea65134f152a85980bbe0a0accc0c26ce)

commit_message:
Present container deletion better

Zun server has changed from synchronous deletion to asynchronous
deletion. This mean Zun accepts a request to delete a container
but the container is not deleted right away. In the UI, it is
better to present the container in 'deleting' state instead of
removing the container from displaying.

Change-Id: I05c64a1388356887aba19dc94f27dbbd0d0bcc02

subject: Check disk quota support on filter scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-04-04 04:04:31.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/unit/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py', 'zun/scheduler/host_state.py', 'zun/container/driver.py', 'zun/compute/compute_node_tracker.py', 'zun/scheduler/filters/disk_filter.py', 'zun/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_disk_filter.py'], 'message': 'Check disk quota support on filter scheduler

The compute manager will provide information about if the node
support disk quota. The DiskFilter will schedule container
based on the disk quota support. If the container request
non-zero amount of disk, the filter scheduler will place the
container to the node that supports disk quota.

Change-Id: I8c4df909775fe120156bb058adf17381205d5a39
'}]
commit_message:
Check disk quota support on filter scheduler

The compute manager will provide information about if the node
support disk quota. The DiskFilter will schedule container
based on the disk quota support. If the container request
non-zero amount of disk, the filter scheduler will place the
container to the node that supports disk quota.

Change-Id: I8c4df909775fe120156bb058adf17381205d5a39

commit_message:
Add disk_quota_supported to compute_node

Add 'disk_quota_supported' field to the data model of compute node.
This field will be leveraged by the scheduler to do filtering based
on disk quota supported of each node.

Change-Id: I8c449c2a44bd6afbc79c4accb083d9f1bf51085a

subject: Print a warning if disk quota is not unsupported
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-04-04 03:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['zun/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Print a warning if disk quota is not unsupported

If the CONF.default_disk is configured to be non-zero but the node
doesn't support disk quota. Zun will ignore the configured
default because it is impossible to be realized. A warning message
will be printed to the log as a record.

Change-Id: Ie322984d5f3212e139470b80076c781b5996a9b1
"}]
commit_message:
Print a warning if disk quota is not unsupported

If the CONF.default_disk is configured to be non-zero but the node
doesn't support disk quota. Zun will ignore the configured
default because it is impossible to be realized. A warning message
will be printed to the log as a record.

Change-Id: Ie322984d5f3212e139470b80076c781b5996a9b1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-06 02:06:02.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py'], 'message': "Cleanup and rename test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot

I'm trying to debug a failure in a nova change
in test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot but
need more debug information, specifically the
volume details when it fails. While doing this,
I'm going to cleanup the comments and variable
names so this test can actually be understanble.

Also, this renames the test itself since the 'ebs'
part (AWS Elastic Block Storage) has long been a
source of confusion.

Change-Id: I4d60adc95d72be609927e36a28fd7c86b5ee86bc
Related-Bug: #1747693
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup and rename test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot

I'm trying to debug a failure in a nova change
in test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot but
need more debug information, specifically the
volume details when it fails. While doing this,
I'm going to cleanup the comments and variable
names so this test can actually be understanble.

Also, this renames the test itself since the 'ebs'
part (AWS Elastic Block Storage) has long been a
source of confusion.

Change-Id: I4d60adc95d72be609927e36a28fd7c86b5ee86bc
Related-Bug: #1747693

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-23 16:30:16.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/ceph-install.yml'], 'message': "Install mon servers in parallel.

The ceph-ansible roles handle restarting services in serial via a
script, so we shouldn't need to run this in serial.

Change-Id: Ia2f2694abe02af282e7a98fcc40410b0510cc1cd
Closes-Bug: #1741085

commit_message:
Install mon servers in parallel.

The ceph-ansible roles handle restarting services in serial via a
script, so we shouldn't need to run this in serial.

Change-Id: Ia2f2694abe02af282e7a98fcc40410b0510cc1cd
Closes-Bug: #1741085

subject: Make memcache limit_maxbytes configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-24 09:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/memcached/templates/memcached.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/memcached/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Make memcache limit_maxbytes configurable

The "limit_maxbytes" default value is 64M. It is not a proper setting
for large cluster. We should make it configurable to fit with more
deployment cases.

Change-Id: I9a85b1b3ade7498495f510897292ae1ed9d73bfa
Closes-Bug: #1758286
'}]
commit_message:
Make memcache limit_maxbytes configurable

The "limit_maxbytes" default value is 64M. It is not a proper setting
for large cluster. We should make it configurable to fit with more
deployment cases.

Change-Id: I9a85b1b3ade7498495f510897292ae1ed9d73bfa
Closes-Bug: #1758286

Change-Id: I423f9a679c161b11cf51337717e4e7e73d71a1b3

commit_message:
Fix revert method for batch member update

The create/delete reverts worked because the old/new member lists were
simply db object lists, but the update list is tuples of (obj, dict) and
need a little bit of massaging.

Change-Id: I423f9a679c161b11cf51337717e4e7e73d71a1b3

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-02-07 18:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/windows-volume-backup-b328858a20f5a499.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/windows/smbfs.py', 'cinder/backup/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/windows/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/backup/test_backup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_swift.py', 'cinder/utils.py', 'cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py'], 'message': "Add Windows volume backup support

This patch makes a few small changes that are required in order to
have the Cinder Backup service working on Windows.

- all physial disks must be open in byte mode. 'rb+' must be used
when writing.
- reading passed the disk size boundary will not return an empty
string, raising an IOError instead. For this reason, we're avoiding
doing it.
- we ensure that the chunk size is a multiple of the sector size.
- the chmod command is not available on Windows. Although changing
owners is possible, it is not needed. For this reason, the
'temporary_chown' helper will be a noop on Windows. It's easier to
do it here rather than do platform checks wherever this gets called.
- when connecting the volumes, we pass the 'expect_raw_disk' argument,
which provides a hint to the connector about what we expect. This
allows the SMBFS connector to return a mounted raw disk path instead
of a virtual image path.
- when the driver provides temporary snapshots to be used during
the backup process, the API is bypassed. For this reason, we need to
ensure that the snapshot state and progress gets updated accordingly.
Otherwise, this breaks the nova assisted snapshot workflow.

We're doing platform checks, ensuring that we don't break/change
the current workflow.

The Swift and Posix backup drivers are known to be working on Windows.

Implements: blueprint windows-smb-backup

Depends-On: #I20f791482fb0912772fa62d2949fa5becaec5675

Change-Id: I8769a135974240fdf7cebd4b6d74aaa439ba1f27
"}]
commit_message:
Add Windows volume backup support

This patch makes a few small changes that are required in order to
have the Cinder Backup service working on Windows.

- all physial disks must be open in byte mode. 'rb+' must be used
when writing.
- reading passed the disk size boundary will not return an empty
string, raising an IOError instead. For this reason, we're avoiding
doing it.
- we ensure that the chunk size is a multiple of the sector size.
- the chmod command is not available on Windows. Although changing
owners is possible, it is not needed. For this reason, the
'temporary_chown' helper will be a noop on Windows. It's easier to
do it here rather than do platform checks wherever this gets called.
- when connecting the volumes, we pass the 'expect_raw_disk' argument,
which provides a hint to the connector about what we expect. This
allows the SMBFS connector to return a mounted raw disk path instead
of a virtual image path.
- when the driver provides temporary snapshots to be used during
the backup process, the API is bypassed. For this reason, we need to
ensure that the snapshot state and progress gets updated accordingly.
Otherwise, this breaks the nova assisted snapshot workflow.

We're doing platform checks, ensuring that we don't break/change
the current workflow.

The Swift and Posix backup drivers are known to be working on Windows.

Implements: blueprint windows-smb-backup

Depends-On: #I20f791482fb0912772fa62d2949fa5becaec5675

Change-Id: I8769a135974240fdf7cebd4b6d74aaa439ba1f27

commit_message:
Remove max_microversion from compute keypairs test

This PS removes the max_microversion = 2.10 from compute
keypairs test because the API isn't deprecated. This is
probably a typo for min_microversion.

Neither the API documentation [0], nor the API code [1], nor
any other supporting documentation [2] suggests that the
os-keypairs API is deprecated in 2.11.

Since min_microversion = 2.10 is not needed, rather than fixing
the supposed typo, max_microversion is removed.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#keypairs-keypairs
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/keypairs.py
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html

Partially Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api
Change-Id: I775565ca2586dd7c861e406abb46204ae0890bce

subject: Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-09 02:14:32.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers

This patch makes the naming of containers more operator friendly.
A sharding/sharded root container would create a <container>_root.db
to manage the shardranges. This signifies that it's a root container
to ops or anyone looking on disk.
When shards cleave, the sharding db that holds the cleaving shardranges
are called <container>_shard.db. Once a shard has completed sharding
the original db is unlinked, then the container is marked as deleted,
so these _shard.db files will be reclaimed.

This patch basically makes looking at the ondisk database files easier
to grok and understand.

Change-Id: Ib9dca9beb87a5a6bf267eb8373c32f7075e5bfcb
"}]
commit_message:
Use _root.db and _shard.db on sharded containers

This patch makes the naming of containers more operator friendly.
A sharding/sharded root container would create a <container>_root.db
to manage the shardranges. This signifies that it's a root container
to ops or anyone looking on disk.
When shards cleave, the sharding db that holds the cleaving shardranges
are called <container>_shard.db. Once a shard has completed sharding
the original db is unlinked, then the container is marked as deleted,
so these _shard.db files will be reclaimed.

This patch basically makes looking at the ondisk database files easier
to grok and understand.

Change-Id: Ib9dca9beb87a5a6bf267eb8373c32f7075e5bfcb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 22:05:59.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/lib/common-functions', 'diskimage_builder/lib/img-functions'], 'message': "Don't use -e to test for what might be broken symlink

The behavior of test -e and [[ -e against broken symlinks is to fail
even if the symlink exists. However we want to test if the link exists
or if there is a file in that location. Therefore switch from test -e to
test -L and test -f to check if the file or link exists regardless of
link target validity.

Change-Id: I84a9b6731eccf950707be50aef464a2de1e33e8e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use -e to test for what might be broken symlink

The behavior of test -e and [[ -e against broken symlinks is to fail
even if the symlink exists. However we want to test if the link exists
or if there is a file in that location. Therefore switch from test -e to
test -L and test -f to check if the file or link exists regardless of
link target validity.

Change-Id: I84a9b6731eccf950707be50aef464a2de1e33e8e

commit_message:
Add robust ldap domain-specific config

This patch set provides PATCH capability for ldap-backed domain config,
and prevents silent failure if the configuration contains erroneous
setting.  This also moves from loading .conf files into DB directly,
and uses the API endpoints.

Change-Id: I17a19046fa96e0f3e8fb029c156ba79c924a0097
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,
then we need to used the default defined in network/config/

Change-Id: If119f3900eb60a217b8209d59fb9bc900107addb
(cherry picked from commit ddc719299968644929a9b2cb0622500b5e9c4e65)

commit_message:
Rally: Install latest version

rally_pip_packages = ['/rally'] should be change to ['rally']
Otherwise rally is not the latest version
$ rally --version
0.10.1~dev137

And leading to create-verifier error
$ rally verify create-verifier --type tempest --name tempest-verifier
Failed to initialize testr.

According to Andrey, https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1751821
"rally>=0.11.1 should be used since
tempest 18 switched from using testrepository (testr) to stestr."

Fix '/rally' to 'rally' can install the latest version
$ rally --version
0.11.2

Change-Id: I511dac6969ebed03cb22a1b1dafe03d8dade3933

commit_message:
Pass whole selected entity to deleteEntity callback

For now, delete-modal service passes only ID to deleteEntity callback.
Some plugins need other parameters to delete entity.
So this patch passes whole selected entity to callback as second argument.

Change-Id: I395470110a5f03ebb08a043ca433b16b999dad3f
Needed-By: Ic5aba9b2e953cde7950ae7656cd5a3fee3f4a55c
Closes-Bug: #1761074

subject: Add a wating status for execution
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-08 07:15:24.000000000', 'files': ['qinling/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_execution.py', 'qinling/engine/default_engine.py', 'qinling/utils/executions.py', 'qinling/status.py'], 'message': 'Add a wating status for execution

If rpc server failed when creating execution, the status of execution will
still keep running, while running status will effect concurrency in
``engine.default_engine.function_load_check``, but the execution does not
occupy any worker pods indeed. So a waiting status will be needed to
prevent rpc cast/call failures.

Change-Id: I617804fa47525f7f7c081475864b9ebfa96e91a1
'}]
commit_message:
Add a wating status for execution

If rpc server failed when creating execution, the status of execution will
still keep running, while running status will effect concurrency in
``engine.default_engine.function_load_check``, but the execution does not
occupy any worker pods indeed. So a waiting status will be needed to
prevent rpc cast/call failures.

Change-Id: I617804fa47525f7f7c081475864b9ebfa96e91a1

commit_message:
Add documention for setting up LDAP

Devstack supports deploying an LDAP server and configuring keystone
to use it, but we didn't have any documentation for it. This commit
adds some basic documentation that should help developers setup
LDAP-backed development environments.

Change-Id: I8ba07d73f52cb7f575ff2953977e9fdcade92d83

devstack: add kubelet iface to openshift nodes

as well as enabling routing to the service network for the OpenShift API
to be reachable by host networking pods.

commit_message:
devstack: Make service subnet routable

We currently have a pod subnet ovs internal port created in devstack.
This allows the kubelet to do the necessary container probes. The
problem is that if we run host networking pods that need to access the
API they won't be able to do it in the expected way (sending HTTP
requests to the clusterIP of the API).

This patch addresses it via routing, so the kubelet iface is used for
the service access.

Closes-Bug: 1743081
Change-Id: I899c925610b69affc5a43bc6ba8ecb8fdee67e90
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Fix failure when adding a speaker to an agent

When get_bgp_speaker_with_advertised_routes() collects the data for BGP
peers, it needs to include the auth_type field, otherwise adding the
speaker to an agent will fail.

(cherry picked from commit fd497a491afec89d4a15cf061b5d5610fb7ad6d2)
Change-Id: I668397be4a531ba5c0628eb23df9a84d0de8c28c
Closes-Bug: 1750121

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-30 06:57:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py'], 'message': "Don't use hypervisor_hostname as compute hostname

Several tempest tests are failing when using the VMware virt driver
where compute hostname != hypervisor_hostname. Those are different
things and cannot be used interchangeably. This patch fixes a
regression introduced with commit 1dc2e231 where the hosts_client was
replaced with hypervisor_client in order to select hosts which are both
up and enabled.

This patch changes the implementation of get_host_other_than() to use
services_client which still allows to select nova computes which are up
and enabled but also gives us the compute hostname.

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba
Closes-Bug: #1759801
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use hypervisor_hostname as compute hostname

Several tempest tests are failing when using the VMware virt driver
where compute hostname != hypervisor_hostname. Those are different
things and cannot be used interchangeably. This patch fixes a
regression introduced with commit 1dc2e231 where the hosts_client was
replaced with hypervisor_client in order to select hosts which are both
up and enabled.

This patch changes the implementation of get_host_other_than() to use
services_client which still allows to select nova computes which are up
and enabled but also gives us the compute hostname.

Change-Id: Ie6df1192e1ca83977dccc8e6b9331dfe874c8aba
Closes-Bug: #1759801

commit_message:
Replace list_hypervisors with list_services

This fixes a regression introduced with commit 88c7ea8 which replaced
list_hosts with list_hypervisors because the former is deprecated.
However, the hypervisor_hostname cannot be used as replacement for
compute hostname. This patch fixes the problem by switching to
list_services which returns compute hostnames.

Change-Id: I948429075e71e11e091703c4b12378c71c37bc29

subject: Fix usage of isotime
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-11-20 09:21:52.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/api/image.py', 'ec2api/api/network_interface.py', 'ec2api/tests/unit/test_cert.pem', 'ec2api/tests/unit/test_ec2_validate.py', 'ec2api/tests/unit/base.py', 'ec2api/tests/unit/fakes.py', 'ec2api/api/ec2utils.py'], 'message': "Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6.

The deprecation message says to use the datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to ec2api.api.ec2utils.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: I33f8a59c0c6ff4ec53d6763b1548dbf9d906acac
Partial-Bug: #1461251
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of isotime

The commit I34b12b96de3ea21beaf935ed8a9f6bae2fe0d0bc and
Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e introduced the
deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() is deprecated
as of 1.6.

The deprecation message says to use the datetime.datetime.isoformat()
instead, but the format of the string generated by isoformat isn't
the same as the format of the string generated by isotime. The string
is used in tokens and other public APIs and we can't change it
without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to ec2api.api.ec2utils.

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: I33f8a59c0c6ff4ec53d6763b1548dbf9d906acac
Partial-Bug: #1461251

commit_message:
Move /rename endpoint into patch

Currently, we have an endpoint (POST /containers/<container>/rename)
for renaming container:
https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L591

We should move this API into PATCH /containers/<container>
(https://github.com/openstack/zun/blob/master/zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py#L570)
because this is the convention of API design in OpenStack
(e.g. nova implements server rename at PUT /servers/<server>)

Depends-On: I0aeb155bc85f1dfbd436be1d39568b0f90ccf027
Change-Id: Ib92b0482b988641aa01f5648f108dc4c8690fa77
Closes-Bug: #1759459

subject: api-ref: document sorting parameters for networks
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-04-04 19:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/networks.inc', 'api-ref/source/v2/parameters.yaml'], 'message': "api-ref: document sorting parameters for networks

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch improves the documentation of these two
sorting parameters.

In particular, we explicitly list all the attributes that can be used
as a sort_key for network resource. This is necessary because the list
of sort_key varies across different resources and it is hard for
API users to guess which resource support which sort_key.

Change-Id: I5183bfe4c835dae0f0bfae61114e9b9be2877b0f
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: document sorting parameters for networks

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch improves the documentation of these two
sorting parameters.

In particular, we explicitly list all the attributes that can be used
as a sort_key for network resource. This is necessary because the list
of sort_key varies across different resources and it is hard for
API users to guess which resource support which sort_key.

Change-Id: I5183bfe4c835dae0f0bfae61114e9b9be2877b0f

Change-Id: I23b5e43c931381cc4ec628659a1f1f250e308c82

commit_message:
Rename Mistral notifier queue

In case there is an execute_mistral action in one of the templates, the
evaluator used to send an event to a queue with a 'mistral' topic.
This change adds a 'vitrage_notifier' prefix to the queue name, to make
it more clear that this is a Vitrage queue.

Change-Id: I23b5e43c931381cc4ec628659a1f1f250e308c82

subject: Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24824, 'name': 'Dmitrii Shcherbakov', 'username': 'dmitriis'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 02:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)
"}]
commit_message:
Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545873/ docker
registry variables always set to "docker.io" for both

commit_message:
Fix docker_registry_* variables for Periodic jobs

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545873/ docker
registry variables always set to "docker.io" for both
periodic and patch jobs because comparison of string
is done with integer which returns "false" always, this patch
fixes it.

Change-Id: Iea10d6bff3b0c0b3f440372326ec221d94e95838

subject: Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 09:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml'], 'message': "Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes

OVH nodepool nodes have an issue which causes nested virt
instances to crash with a hardware error, then a dump.
We therefore detect whether we're running on OVH and
force it to use qemu instead.

Change-Id: I54681092adf9c0647bf65583176ddc21c99494f3
(cherry picked from commit cc98ed84f166cc7dd09ff0157764b3f4d06391b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Work around nested virt issues on OVH test nodes

OVH nodepool nodes have an issue which causes nested virt
instances to crash with a hardware error, then a dump.
We therefore detect whether we're running on OVH and
force it to use qemu instead.

Change-Id: I54681092adf9c0647bf65583176ddc21c99494f3
(cherry picked from commit cc98ed84f166cc7dd09ff0157764b3f4d06391b6)

commit_message:
Use a pythonic delete, with a retry.

Replace an exec() of rm with a more pythonic thing, with a simple
retry loop now that we can't just use the one oslo gives us for
free. The retry delay is the same as that currently used by
oslo.

Change-Id: Icdd039bb4374269d9da38e7f8d2e15e05ca8aadb
blueprint: execs-ive-had-a-few

This patch fixes it by updating the isolated metadata proxy on port_update_end

commit_message:
Spawn/stop metadata proxies upon adding/deleting router interfaces

When a network becomes isolated and isolated_metadata_enabled=True, the DHCP
agent won't spawn the required metadata proxy instance unless the agent gets
restarted. Similarly, it won't stop them when the network is no longer
isolated.

This patch fixes it by updating the isolated metadata proxy on port_update_end
and port_delete_end methods which are invoked every time a router interface
port is added, updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I5c197a5755135357c6465dfe4803019a2ad52c14
Closes-Bug: #1753540
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from 9362d4f1f21df2a27c818bb0c2918241eb67e3d0)
(cherry picked from commit b07aa19deb82604b954f323a76c70cc623601ca7)

commit_message:
Don't log set_fact tasks for role_data

set_fact logs the fact value. In the case of reading the role_data_*
files, this is very verbose as the files can be large. Use no_log: True
to make these tasks less verbose. The content is saved in the
config-download output already, so no useful info is lost.

Change-Id: Ie6f75113194961628a0c9bdfbfbf5d88a18059eb
Closes-Bug: #1760996

subject: Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 7016, 'name': 'Swaminathan Vasudevan', 'email': 'swvasude@cisco.com', 'username': 'souminathan'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24824, 'name': 'Dmitrii Shcherbakov', 'username': 'dmitriis'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 02:38:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': "Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)
"}]
commit_message:
Use cidr during tenant network rule deletion

If a distributed router has interfaces on multiple tenant networks, with
'fast exit' functionality policy based rules are created in qrouter
namespace for every tenant network subnet and 'from <cidr>' is included
into an 'ip rule' command invocation.

When a port on a tenant network is deleted 'from <cidr>' part is not
included and a first rule matching specified parameters gets deleted.

For example with the following layout

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
80000:  from 192.168.100.0/24 lookup 16
80000:  from 192.168.200.0/24 lookup 16

and neutron l3 agent will use this command

ip netns exec qrouter-4f9ca9ef-303b-4082-abbc-e50782d9b800 ip -4 rule\
del priority 80000 table 16 type unicast

and 192.168.100.0/24 rule will get deleted even if you actually removed
a port on 192.168.200.0.

This results in an extra rule present and not cleaned up and the right
rule removed. It is only recreated if a router is disabled and enabled
again.

additional changes:

1) Floating IP rules are identified by priority only as implemented
currently - for this reason this change adds fixed_ip to the rule
removal code. Rule priorities are 32-bit values in iproute2 so,
in theory, those should be not be used to cover IPv6.

2) IP protocol information for 'from all' rules is currently
derived from link-local address IP version. The same approach
is preserved by using version-specific /0 addresses without
changing the API provided by ip_lib.

Change-Id: I0ea6dddd26e17771be223a1fbdf21792c90f3e9c
Closes-Bug: #1759956
(cherry picked from commit 81db328b2df08f2b4adcc80104cf05ad8966c019)

commit_message:
Fix callback plugin for Ansible 2.5 compatability

Ansible 2.5 changed an internal callback method around that is
expected in plugins for options. In order for this to work, we needed
to make some minor changes.

Change-Id: I3801f339511155a4b8ecab91bb06b286b11c0a06
Related-Bug: #1758462
(cherry picked from commit 3631fd4791dd13977e446ee8445dbd1225d890bc)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-04 17:11:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

The ComputeManager.pre_live_migration method, which runs on the
destination host during live migration, calls setup_networks_on_host
with the destination host which causes the "migrating_to" attribute
to get set to the destination host in the port binding profile. This
is to initiate setting up floating IP information on the destination
host for DVR.

The ComputeManager.post_live_migration_at_destination method calls the
same method from the destination host, so at this point the "migrating_to"
attribute is already set to the destination host in the port binding
profile from pre_live_migration and we make unnecessary port update calls
to Neutron for each port attached to the instance.

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary port update during live migration

The ComputeManager.pre_live_migration method, which runs on the
destination host during live migration, calls setup_networks_on_host
with the destination host which causes the "migrating_to" attribute
to get set to the destination host in the port binding profile. This
is to initiate setting up floating IP information on the destination
host for DVR.

The ComputeManager.post_live_migration_at_destination method calls the
same method from the destination host, so at this point the "migrating_to"
attribute is already set to the destination host in the port binding
profile from pre_live_migration and we make unnecessary port update calls
to Neutron for each port attached to the instance.

This change simply checks to see if the "migrating_to" attribute is
already set to the given host and if so, skips the port update call.

Change-Id: I8b2ffd94c5ff0881d0df4efdde9be938888c16d7
Closes-Bug: #1758453

commit_message:
Converge distro interfaces to systemd-networkd

This change pulls all of our different distro interfaces into a unfied
set. To do this, we're using a common systemd-networkd role which gives
all distros the same network setup, capabilities, and configurations.

Change-Id: I770fc7296490ed09320f9a2e678758d971e2e29a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 15:44:14.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-tasks/os-log-dir-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781
'}]
commit_message:
Add default value for log_dirs in os-log-dir-setup.yml

There is no default value for log_dirs in the os-log-dir-setup.yml
which means that any role that includes it without that value will
crash and burn.  We set a default here to protect us from breaking
roles in the future if we forget to specifiy log_dirs on baremetal.

Change-Id: I07bf9f4bce7bb53ecc305d260142e878797d6c04
Closes-Bug: #1761781

commit_message:
Add support for per role FFU upgrade

This change adds the option to run the FFU workflow in batches per
roles. The newly introduced workflow first updates the controller
role and then the compute role. In addition it enables running FFU
for compute nodes in a rolling fashion.

Change-Id: I996df8f149ffefe71b20a82cbc979cdc5b3dda11
(cherry picked from commit 1f004eeb769ece48e39ace9ea002925eff7900f6)

commit_message:
Support both rabbitmq and oslo.messaging service nodes

This commit selects either the rabbitmq hosts or the
hosts associated to oslo.messaging rpc and notify services.
This is required for the transition of t-h-t to the use
of the separated oslo.messaging service backends.

This patch:
*select rpc and notify hosts from rabbitmq or oslo_messaging
*modify qdrouterd inter-router link port
*update qdr unit spec
*add release note

Needed-By: I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0
Change-Id: I154e2fe6f66b296b9b643627d57696e5178e1815

commit_message:
Clarify deprecation of "async" parameter

For vendor passthru decorators, the "async" parameter is deprecated.
This clarifies the messaging we emit (via logs and release notes), and
adds a TODO so we don't forget to delete the "async" parameter in
Stein cycle.

This is a follow up to Change-Id: I6299aafd30faae9a93df2cb901c1505df47e6b45.

Change-Id: I63ddf453584f4e7e8d2fa778ec50b8debcb86bf4
Task: 9289
Story: 1751306

commit_message:
undercloud: allow to configure ctlplane_masquerade in undercloud.conf

In some setups, we need to enable masquerading (it's the case in our CI
with OVB jobs), so we need to use the new interface from tripleoclient
so we can enable the feature and configure the masquerading rules.

Change-Id: I94f1783f5673941d2b72ef8077c84e547d7536df

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-04-05 15:10:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py'], 'message': 'Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes

Closes-Bug: #1759971
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh router objects after port binding

Post-binding information about router ports is missing in results of RPC
calls made by l3 agents. sync_routers code ensures that bindings are
present, however, it does not refresh router objects before returning
them - for RPC clients ports remain unbound before the next sync and
there is no necessary address scope information present to create routes
from fip namespaces to qrouter namespaces.

Change-Id: Ia135f0ed7ca99887d5208fa78fe4df1ff6412c26
Closes-Bug: #1759971

Otherwise neutron server may set BUILD status for ports not bound
to agent's host.

subject: Fix intermittent failing probetest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 01:01:08.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/common.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/common/wsgi.py', 'test/unit/common/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Fix intermittent failing probetest

When running probetests in a loop I discovered that the
container-servers were not always shutdown cleanly.  When handling the
SIGTERM received by a manager the parent process would occasionally
crash an assertion in the eventlet hub by doing blocking I/O in a signal
handler.  The child process would never receive the forwarded SIGTERM
and continue to accept requests on the listening socket.

By moving all I/O (logging and the associated PipeMutex locking) out of
the signal handler the child processes can reliably shutdown cleanly.

In my samples the test seems to be significantly more stable.

Change-Id: I5436063299f88106353cfa0ecd9a8b0b59c7af25
'}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent failing probetest

When running probetests in a loop I discovered that the
container-servers were not always shutdown cleanly.  When handling the
SIGTERM received by a manager the parent process would occasionally
crash an assertion in the eventlet hub by doing blocking I/O in a signal
handler.  The child process would never receive the forwarded SIGTERM
and continue to accept requests on the listening socket.

By moving all I/O (logging and the associated PipeMutex locking) out of
the signal handler the child processes can reliably shutdown cleanly.

In my samples the test seems to be significantly more stable.

Change-Id: I5436063299f88106353cfa0ecd9a8b0b59c7af25

subject: Do the api_db sync before db sync
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-06 16:05:08.000000000', 'files': ['projects/60_nova/upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Do the api_db sync before db sync

This patch swaps the order of doing api_db sync with db_sync.
The API database migration should be run before the migrations for
the main/cell databases. This is because the former contains
information about how to find and connect to the latter.

This was discovered in Rocky since we added a data model change
(a new column to the cell_mappings table) that depends on db sync
being run after having added this new column to the api_db (i.e running
api_db sync before db sync). The data model change was the first time
where the actual sync order became meaningful.

This has been correctly done in devstack and the fact that grenade was
doing the db sync before api_db sync was hidden by the fact that
devstack had run at least once before reaching this part of grenade,
which meant that the database was already initialized.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775
'}]
commit_message:
Do the api_db sync before db sync

This patch swaps the order of doing api_db sync with db_sync.
The API database migration should be run before the migrations for
the main/cell databases. This is because the former contains
information about how to find and connect to the latter.

This was discovered in Rocky since we added a data model change
(a new column to the cell_mappings table) that depends on db sync
being run after having added this new column to the api_db (i.e running
api_db sync before db sync). The data model change was the first time
where the actual sync order became meaningful.

This has been correctly done in devstack and the fact that grenade was
doing the db sync before api_db sync was hidden by the fact that
devstack had run at least once before reaching this part of grenade,
which meant that the database was already initialized.

Change-Id: Ic790ef7c3531c2b672621310524797548246b2ef
Closes-Bug: #1761775

commit_message:

The single function in the api utils module has been moved for some time
and no one is using it today [1].

This patch removes the neutron_lib.api.utils module.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron_lib.api%20import%20utils

Change-Id: I28c496e9f686a7b83e86703a8b5ee2ec420e72e1

subject: Ensure neutron-vpn-agent not used in Trusty Mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-05 14:29:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/basic_deployment.py', 'hooks/neutron_utils.py'], 'message': 'Ensure neutron-vpn-agent not used in Trusty Mitaka

The neutron-vpn-agent package was deprecated some time
ago and Xenial Mitaka install will use the
neutron-l3-agent package where as Trusty Mitaka will
erroneously install neutron-vpn-agent.

Change-Id: Ibfb53851683a685b252174504cbe2efaf43e6e9d
Closes-Bug: #1761514
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure neutron-vpn-agent not used in Trusty Mitaka

The neutron-vpn-agent package was deprecated some time
ago and Xenial Mitaka install will use the
neutron-l3-agent package where as Trusty Mitaka will
erroneously install neutron-vpn-agent.

Change-Id: Ibfb53851683a685b252174504cbe2efaf43e6e9d
Closes-Bug: #1761514

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in lower-constraints

Fix lower-constraints don't match the lower bounds
in the requirements file(s). It causes fail in
requirements-check.

REF:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: I5f26375a5e55da9449635dbfd0b0e8d0968f485e

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: I6d7a9af234b7a8a6e83f9a730ffe1c4fd698786a
(cherry picked from commit e7b21c813ca9c53b02f4629c669b041c77b87c3e)

subject: Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-05 14:02:03.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved

As feddora 26 nodes are in the process of being removed to be
replaced with fedora 27, this ps moves the fedora job to be
nonvoting until we can get any issues with fedora 27 resolved.

Change-Id: I5a494ded649ae3fa3be5ab133d1080d6fb6dd3d7
'}]
commit_message:
Make fedora job nonvoting until issues resolved

As feddora 26 nodes are in the process of being removed to be
replaced with fedora 27, this ps moves the fedora job to be
nonvoting until we can get any issues with fedora 27 resolved.

Change-Id: I5a494ded649ae3fa3be5ab133d1080d6fb6dd3d7

subject: [cli] Use json.loads instead of yaml while importing results
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-06 16:04:17.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/commands/task.py', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_task.py', 'rally/common/objects/task.py'], 'message': '[cli] Use json.loads instead of yaml while importing results

Rally Task results are json file, there are no reasons to use yaml
deserializer for importing result. Even more, usage of yaml
deserializer affects the performance of import operation.

Change-Id: I965e0608ed8667e4a43de3323a63a948dab29bd6
'}]
commit_message:
[cli] Use json.loads instead of yaml while importing results

Rally Task results are json file, there are no reasons to use yaml
deserializer for importing result. Even more, usage of yaml
deserializer affects the performance of import operation.

Change-Id: I965e0608ed8667e4a43de3323a63a948dab29bd6

subject: DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-06 02:37:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/item_allocator.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_item_allocator.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260
(cherry picked from commit ed7dd4dae0cf80f2314d9e113995e63a362b8295)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Check for item_allocator key before releasing

item_allocator class maintains the allocation of
items(link local address) from a given pool.
There may be cases where the key has been already
released or not being remembered while trying to
release it.
So it makes sense to lookup for the key before
releasing the key.

Change-Id: I34765dd3efa6c6742caeb7f6ae2ff14009dce6dd
Closes-Bug: #1761260
(cherry picked from commit ed7dd4dae0cf80f2314d9e113995e63a362b8295)
